title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Iranian missile strike devastates two buildings at Israel’s Weizmann Institute
items.description: Hundreds of scientists have lost labs, equipment, and specimens

items.title: Sharks may use an unexpected organ to fight microbial invaders
items.description: The pancreas, which helps control blood sugar in humans, may be critical part of shark immune system

items.title: U.S. researchers are speaking up for science in local newspapers
items.description: Through two grassroots efforts, more than 80 op eds have been published in news outlets across the country

items.title: ‘Truly amazing’: Octopuses ‘taste’ harmful microbes with their suckers
items.description: Unique ability allows the animals to protect themselves and their offspring from decaying food and other material

items.title: Judge orders NIH to restore hundreds of grants cut under Trump
items.description: William Young calls terminations illegal, berates agency for discrimination

items.title: Evidence of massive dinosaur mating ritual uncovered in Colorado
items.description: Drone imagery reveals ancient arena where Tyrannosaurus rex– or ostrichlike dinos may have wooed mates

items.title: U.S. academics call for reforms in research overhead payments, hoping to avoid drastic cuts
items.description: Coalition offers two models it says increase accountability and reflect the “true costs” of research

items.title: Radio bursts reveal universe’s ‘missing matter’
items.description: Mystery signals used to locate gases in the spaces between galaxies

items.title: Congress shows first signs of resisting Trump’s plans to slash science budgets
items.description: House panel rejects cuts to agricultural research, and Senators express doubts about cuts to NIH and forest research

items.title: The members of RFK Jr.’s new vaccine committee have published little on vaccines
items.description: Purge at immunization panel represents a major loss of expertise, as measured by scientific papers
